summary: Although hospitalizations and deaths associated with COVID-19 have recently decreased, the pandemic continues to challenge U.S. response and recovery efforts. The federal response continues to focus on vaccinations, testing, and treatment. As of March 2022, we have made 279 recommendations to improve the federal response, such as collecting data on long-term COVID-19 effects. Agencies have fully or partially addressed 39% of our recommendations. In this...
title: COVID-19: Current and Future Federal Preparedness Requires Fixes to Improve Health Data and Address Improper Payments
